title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. The response must be consistent with the answer to part (a). For example, if the student does not put one pair of nonbonding electrons on the P MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGqbaaaa@39D1@ atom, the consistent response that would earn the point is trigonal planar.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that the molecule is trigonal pyramidal.
The response indicates that the molecule is trigonal pyramidal.

descriptions: The response does not indicate that the curves are horizontal (slope=0) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaGGOaGaae4Cai aabYgacaqGVbGaaeiCaiaabwgacqGH9aqpcaaIWaGaaiykaaaa@40C9@ at equilibrium, so the concentrations of the reactants and product are not changing, therefore the rate of the forward reaction must be the same as the rate of the reverse reaction.
